website_summaries.verdict: A sandal and trail shoe in one package, the Hoka One One Tor Trafa is well known for delivering comfort and traction. Its well-built design, abundant in-shoe cushioning and lightweight construction also gained positive remarks. Although the unconventional lacing brought some inconveniences, undoubtedly it was still able to perform on the trails.
pros: Many Hoka One One Tor Trafa owners mentioned that the sandal was sturdy and well-made
Almost all consumers reiterated how comfortable it was to wear the Tor Trafa
A majority of users liked its sufficient traction on different surfaces
An abundance of wearers did not expect this footwear to be that light because of its rugged look
Several of those who wore this sandal mentioned how great the arch support was
A lot of users agreed that this sandal had good and ample cushioning
According to loads of owners, the Hoka One One Tor Trafa runs true to size
It was pricey, yet it was worth it, as stated by some buyers
A small group of hikers appreciated its protective and spacious toe room
A high percentage of online shoppers noted that it was true to width
The breathability of this Tor Trafa from Hoka One One was satisfying, as declared by umpteen hikers
The versatility of this hiking sandal was approved by hordes of outdoor lovers
cons: A wearer commented that the lacing system takes some getting used to
A handful was disappointed when the Tor Trafa from Hoka One One wore out quickly

customer_reviews.title: A whole new category of foot wear.
customer_reviews.text: I have quite a few Hoka shoes and 1 pair of sandals. These are in their own category, which is a good thing. You can wear them barefoot or with socks and for some reason my plantar fasciitis doesn't hurt at all when I wear these and my Hoka sandals. All of my Hoka sneakers I have had to add dr. Scholl plantar inserts. Very happy with this product. To put on real easy, grab the bottom of the ankle support and pull. Don't use the little hook, it's going to eventually rip and is practically useless.
customer_reviews.author: MRBARBARYCOAST

customer_reviews.title: Fit is too tight.  Order at least a half size larger.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these about 4 days, so not a long term review. First, I wear a size 9.5 (US). They were way too tight and my toes made contact with the end of the shoe. Returning them and getting a bigger size was no problem. The size 10's are still a bit snug, but fit OK. I had to loosen the elastic straps completely. Would've been nice to try these on in a local store, but these shoes are not widely sold. So far, all is good. I like how the sole grips well and is very non-slip. I would compare them to Keen H20's
customer_reviews.author: R. Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but Durability Concern
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed with the construction, but very comfortable. I wore them on vacation at Disney World and the beach and they were very comfortable even when wet. I had read another review that had concerns about the quality but decided to purchase anyway. I haven't had any problems ... yet. I do worry about the stitching around the top of the interior liner. It seems like it will rip out pretty easily so I'm careful every time I put them on.. That and the slightly awkward way you have to put your foot inside are the reason for only 4 stars. The Velcro closure on the Tevas is a much better design, but the Hokas are much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite river shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've had Keens and other river shoes, and they always trap rocks which you then try to ineffectually shake out before finally resorting to removing your shoe. This shoe seems to trap fewer rocks, and the heal is more open, which allows them to flush out the back easier. I also like the overall Hoka fit, decent arch support, the cinching system is a bit of a pain if you're taking them on and off a lot, but unlike older Keen's, the strap never loosens.
customer_reviews.author: David Ahlers

customer_reviews.title: Best support for my feet, ever!
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from Plantar Fasciitis in my left foot, as well as flat feet.. While speaking to our new neighbors a couple of weeks ago, she mentioned that she had the same condition. She HIGHLY recommended Hoka shoes, saying that they were "magic". I thought about it for a few days, then rolled the dice and ordered a pair. She was so right! The minute I put them on and stood up, the pain literally vanished. I usually use a cane, to help take some of the weight off my foot, but I don't need to with these shoes. Well worth the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Jim L. Corn

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, but..
customer_reviews.text: Since there is no stretch or adjustment in the heel, they're a pain to put on. But the Hoka soles are so comfortable, I'm on my second pair. This time, I went up a size to make them a little easier to get on. These shoes would be perfect if they'd add an adjustable heel strap like the one's on Merrill's.
customer_reviews.author: M. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Bad shoes
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculously high and painful arch support like most expensive Hawaiian sandals, hard to put on even with a half-size up and since it has to be a half-size up to put on it's too big and causes blisters. Waste of money. Will not buy from this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: TheAmazinMosesLeroy

customer_reviews.title: Comfort
customer_reviews.text: I love the Hoka brand. This is the 2nd pair of shoes I've bought. The 1st pair were for some serious 5k's. This pair I'm planning for leisurely walking.
customer_reviews.author: Mo Time6

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoes. Not available
customer_reviews.text: Good long distance walking shoe. The soles last about 600 miles for serious use. Not tested on difficult terrain. Apparently they aren't readily available.
customer_reviews.author: Squareneck

customer_reviews.title: Would prefer a step to secure the sandal.
customer_reviews.text: I would the neoprene part of the sandal. Find it may be too warm for summer , considering you have to pull the sandal. A little annoying. But they are very comfortable to walk on. Hopefully the pull on slip off will become easier after a good amount of time wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin T.

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Great sandal. I have become a real fan of Hoka products during the past year. I hope Hoka continues to make this sandal. The sandal is very comfortable, and I wore them all day the first time I had them on.
customer_reviews.author: Retired in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and durable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I recommended this shoe to a friend that was taking a trip to Vietnam. He has history of knee injuries and needed a shoe with support and comfort. Upon his return he reported that the shoes exceeded his expectations. He went on multi excursions which involved extended walking on damp, slippery terrain and was happy on the shoe’s performance and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Zometa

customer_reviews.title: Was not comfortable at all.
customer_reviews.text: The way you really have to struggle to get these on was the first thing I didn't like. Then the akward leg strap rubbed on the back of my ankle. Sent them back
customer_reviews.author: S. Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect but pricy
customer_reviews.text: Super light weight, great fitting, comfortable and supportive...Perfect! Soft cushioned interior footbed on the inside, sturdy lug sole on the bottom-side...and pricy so it makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: TR3

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and keeps my plantar fasciitis at bay
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and keeps my plantar fasciitis at bay. Only complaint is that pulling them on is a bit awkward. I think they would have worked better with a velcro connection in back of ankle, or front.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas O. Dahl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome comfortable sandal!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great sandal!!! Bought these for my trip to the Lost City Trek in Colombia. We were in the jungle needed a pair of sandals to do river crossings and to walk around camp. I also used them at the eco resort we stayed at before the trek. They are super comfortable and great support like the running shoes. Only thing is they are a little heavy which I was fine with because I didn’t want to sacrifice comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Riverway

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Better Sandal
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected from HOka One One. Hard to get on. Felt flimsy and rather cheap. Looked a lot like a Teva Dozier but not as solid.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Dee

customer_reviews.title: My favorite shoes
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of Hoka's Tor Trafa. I love them as an every day casual shoe. My go-to shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Bartholomew Williams

customer_reviews.title: I am always a 10 but I couldn't even get ...
customer_reviews.text: I am always a 10 but I couldn't even get one on so had to go up to an 11 which was still tight at the back to get on now they are worn in they are ok. Unfortunately not the Hoka cushioned effect I am used to somewhere half way.
customer_reviews.author: Andy glover

customer_reviews.title: feels good.
customer_reviews.text: go up a half size. after 2 uses one of the pull on loops in the back broke but other that very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Great Gift

customer_reviews.title: Good but didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: They were great when I first Got them. I walk a lot at work. But they’ve worn down to nothing in less than 3 months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fits great
customer_reviews.text: My husband has foot problems and these shoes help him very much!
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Tyo

customer_reviews.title: A little bigger
customer_reviews.text: My size is 10, but I use 10 1/2 for this pair and it’s perfect thanks
customer_reviews.author: zea

customer_reviews.title: great outdoor/hiking sandal
customer_reviews.text: great shoe. Not as thick of a foor bed as some of the other Hoka models but better than my keens.
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: Best outdoor shoe I’ve ever had.
customer_reviews.text: These have become my everyday shoe. They are comfortable and durable. I will most assuredly buy another pair if these ever wear out.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy berg

customer_reviews.title: Wicked cool and comfy too
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable shoes that I've purchased in awhile... own three pairs. Hoke one one please re-issue these fabulous hiker sandals
customer_reviews.author: Trent laird

customer_reviews.title: Cool and Comfortable Hokas
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoes! Look awesome and are light weight. Shipped and received fast.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these shoes ❗️
customer_reviews.text: I wore these shoes maybe five times and the back strap broke off. Very disappointing at $94 + a pair.
customer_reviews.author: TOM JOHNSON

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very well built and fit per actual size. The design could use some larger venting slots.
customer_reviews.author: Shad Roundy

customer_reviews.title: My husband received these sandals, put them on and ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband received these sandals, put them on and played a round of golf. He loves these and his athletic shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes they are so comfortable it's like walking on air
customer_reviews.author: Stan Lopata

product_meta.title: Hoka One M Tor Trafa Shoes, Men, Men
product_meta.description: It is the kind of shoe that llevarías throughout the day, throughout the summer, and that you never quitarías. The Dream of every passionate of the nature. Robust, but light; with good support, but without sacrificing speed. Imagine a cross 4 x 4 with a sport that has the most comfortable seats and immersive you've tested in your life. Bathe the thanks to Hoka One One, which has a soft EVA material placed in a structure of rMat midsole. Its strategically placed flex grooves provide greater flexibility of torque to the shoe, which facilitates the adaptation of the foot on uneven surfaces. In addition, thanks to a wider rubber toe-cap and the spoils of neoprene, offers softness and protection where you need it most. To finish the design, the Nubuck leather provides a quality finish to the instep. This shoe is crying to you that the banter to live a new adventure.
feature_bullets: Features of this item include: EVA, Hiking, Lace Up
